fields.description:
# See video
# Clone plus plugin 3.0 installed - default install will show the issue like so: !action-menu.png|thumbnail!
# Both the standard JIRA clone actions and the clone plus actions get corrupted
# Occurs when user refreshes the current issue by clicking on the issue key link
# Once corrupted, clicking again may show a different corruption
# Using browser refresh seems to reset back to good behavior
# Both Chrome and Firefox browsers show error
# The clone plus actions are defined similar to:
{noformat}
<web-item key="clone-plus-plus-item" i18n-name-key="clonePlus.plus.operation.label" section="operations-operations" weight="21">
{noformat}
# Some (not all) share the same weight
fields.summary: Action menu gets corrupted on issue refresh
As a user in a globally distributed organization, I would like to have internationalization for file upload button

fields.description: If you create an issue in JIRA, and manually set the reporter to another user at the time of issue creation, the activity stream widget will show the reporter as the user who created the issue.
fields.summary: Activity stream shows reporter as the creator of an issue if the reporter field is manually set.

fields.description:
Observed: A search with JQL:

key = ABC-123

showed one issue with a status of Resolved. Opening the issue in a new tab showed a view screen with a status of Closed. Adding a comment to the issue to reindex the issue caused the status displayed in the issue navigator to change to Closed.

Expected: the status shown in the issue navigator should be the same as the status seen on the view screen for an issue
fields.summary: Status in Issue Navigator different from status in issue

fields.description:
When editing a gadget and entering a Project or Saved Filter in IE 8, it display behind other informations and you can't see/select the Project or Saved Filter. 

Please see attached screenshot to better understand.
fields.summary: Filter dropdown displays behind other fields in Internet Explorer 8
JIRA > Workflow Helper With Better Messaging

fields.description:
I am getting a 403 forbidden page when I click on "leave JIRA to go to User Management" button.
I am a Jira admin and should have to correct privileges.  
Am I missing something?
fields.summary: 403 when clicking User Managment
Workload vs Assigned
Extra date range filter to dashboard widgets

fields.description:
Java 7 v51 has been updated on my PC and created an issue in Jira (v4.1.1#522) in IE8. 

Attaching a sceeshot through More actions tab in the created issue redirects me to oracle web page.

Does all versions of Jira supports Java7 v51 or any particular? Or any security settings need to be changed?

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Attaching sceenshot through More Actions tab redirects me to oracle page.

fields.description:
JIRA doesn't convert the time properly according to user timezone preference setting. This is affecting timestamps for activities other than comments' and the first issue created timestamps.

Check screenshot below - the middle timestamp is not converted properly:
!timestamps.png!

User profile is with *GMT+5.30* and JIRA system is *GMT*.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't convert the time properly according to user timezone preference setting
Show field values at creation in History tab

fields.description: Previously we have installed Jira on windows by using exe(where the tomcat is bundled with the application). We have migrated that Jira to a new server, where it has been deployed in different tomcat as war file. Though the same database backup we have restored on the same, But Previous attachment for the projects are missing. So please tell us how can i able to bring that attachment to the migrated application which is running as jira-war.
fields.summary: Jira Migration Issue

fields.description:
When an issue is created (using full browser CreateIssueDetails.jspa and not using the pop-up screen) and and mandatory fields do not have a value, then the following error message comes:

----
(!) summary: You must specify a summary of the issue.
customfield_10300: Project Number is required.
----

It is not necessary to give the field_id (eg: summary and customfield_10300) because:
# since the field_id is not visible to the end user anywhere else, and
# the field_ids are not given in the messages below the fields or in the pop-up create issue form.

h4.How to reproduce
# Create a custom field
# Add the custom field to a screen
# Make the custom field 'required' or mandatory for the project and screen.
# Create a new issue using the full screen form (not the pop-up form)
# Do not enter the mandatory fields (summary and custom field) and press 'Create'
# The error message with the field ids 'summary' and 'customfield_nnn' will be displayed.
fields.summary: Removing field_id from the field validation message during issue creation

fields.description:
I got an email saying that I mentioned myself in a JIRA ticket.

Repro?: Clone a ticket with a user tag (e.g., [~jeremy.viehland]) in the description.

1.  User `A' creates a ticket; and, in the description, mentions user `B' with the syntax: {noformat}[~jeremy.viehland]{noformat}
2.  User `B' works on the ticket and creates a clone.
3.  User `B' receives a mention email about themself.

Since I'm the one creating the clone, I feel that I should not need to be sent a mention email.

{noformat}
-----Original Message-----
From: Jeremy Viehland (JIRA) [mailto:jira-comments@whatever.com] 
Sent: Friday, February 21, 2014 4:48 PM
To: Jeremy Viehland
Subject: [JIRA] Jeremy Viehland mentioned you (JIRA)
     [ https://jira.whatever.com/browse/CDS-15822?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:all-tabpanel ]

Jeremy Viehland mentioned you on CDS-15822
----------------------------------

[...proprietary stuff omitted...]

[~jeremy.viehland] I cc'd you on  this ticket because I know you did a lot of work on the original, related ticket.


>                 Key: CDS-15822

>         View Online: https://jira.whatever.com/browse/CDS-15822
>         Add Comment: 
> https://jira.whatever.com/browse/CDS-15822#add-comment

Hint: You can mention someone in an issue description or comment by typing  "@" in front of their username.


--
This message is automatically generated by JIRA.
If you think it was sent incorrectly, please contact your JIRA administrators For more information on JIRA, see: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira


{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37151].
  {panel}

From working with just a small influx of bug report on a few of my project i noticed it can be difficult to deal with the report. Mainly duplicate bug reports, and poorly created bug reports can be a main. I've found this is mainly due to users not knowing how to check for duplicate issues, and how to generate reports. So my suggestions to solve this are as follow

### 1) Custom section for report types
The idea is to allow repo owners to divide up the bug report area into different pages. Say one page for actual issues, another for tweeks to settings, and another for suggestions. This way users don't get confused on what is a bug and was is a request. Currently i've been handling this with filter but that only helps the devs out. Most basic users don't use filters to search threw bugs. 

### 2) Bug report templates
Repo owners should have the option to setup a report template that auto fills into the bug report. This way the user can answer simple questions that we always ask them. For example the version number of the software they have. 

### 3) FAQ , and instruction page 
It would be very useful for a FAQ & instruction page to open up for users before they report an issue. This way users can see that we want a set guide line for report. I've tried handling this with an issue report that list guide lines, but it floats to the bottom of the report list.

### 4) Sticky report
Common bug report should have the option to be stickied to the top of the report list. This way users can find the report faster, and i can keep basic info report in sight.
fields.summary: [Feature Request] Bug reporting improvements

fields.description:
I found this...

The suggestions in Assignee dropdown are calculated in the following manner :
1. First Jira picks up a list of last (maximum) 5 users that the current user has assigned issues to (say Tony, Jack, Alex, Rita, James).
2. Then Jira picks up a list of users that this issue has been assigned to in the past (say Ram).
3. After this, Jira adds to this, the reporter of this issue (say Ram).
4. After this, the list is compiled and the duplicates are removed (with above example we will have Tony, Jack, Alex, Rita, James, Ram in the list).
5. Lastly, they are arranged in the ascending order (Alex, Jack, James, Ram, Rita, Tony) and then displayed in the Assignee dropdown.

Check all of the screen shot in the right order...

In this test cas the only premise that should be executed is the #1 (First Jira picks up a list of last (maximum) 5 users that the current user has assigned issues to), the #3 (After this, Jira adds to this, the reporter of this issue), the #4 (After this, the list is compiled and the duplicates are removed) and the #5 (arranged in the ascending order)...

So what wrong? Why Chantal, Nanacy and Patrick are always there?
Why Véronique do not stay in the list after the first assignation?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37142].
  {panel}

Use case:
Bob and Sally are both editing story 123. Bob saves his changes first and so when Sally saves her changes she has overwritten Bob's changes without even knowing it (without performing some forensics in the story's history). This last write win is undesired.

Better would be to use an optimistic locking mechanism where a version/revision number is saved on the story that is incremented each time it is modified. This version is then checked when saving (often by providing the version in the sql query's where clause) and rejecting the update if an old version is being updated.

To revisit the Bob/Sally example:
Bob and Sally are editing version 1 of the story. When Bob saves his changes the version is incremented to 2. When Sally saves her changes the system detects that an old version is being saved and would reject with a message that the story has been updated while she was editing it. Or at least warn Sally that she's about to overwrite another user's changes--maybe with a yes/no prompt to let her confirm that's what she wants to do.
fields.summary: Notify user when editing a story will overwrite another user's changes

fields.description:
That's a problem impacting plugin developers who would like to use other language than English in their Velocity files used as templates for web-panel modules (e.g. a web-panel injected into issue view screen).
JIRA uses {{com.atlassian.templaterenderer.velocity.one.six.internal.VelocityTemplateRendererImpl}} which in turn uses {{org.apache.velocity.runtime.RuntimeInstance#getTemplate(String)}} method to get velocity template and this method uses {{org.apache.velocity.runtime.RuntimeInstance#getDefaultEncoding}} to determine the encoding used by the template.
For me it's ISO-8859-1 which is plainly wrong - devs usually encode all their templates with UTF-8.

This problem does not happen in other places in JIRA - e.g. while rendering reports or custom fields as here JIRA uses {{com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine}} which sets the encoding using {{com.atlassian.jira.config.properties.ApplicationProperties.getEncoding}} (returning UTF-8 by default)

Looks like the fix should be around atlassian-template-renderer library used by JIRA.

Related problem (the same root cause) was reported at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/198669/how-to-set-velocity-template-encoding

I believe that we have had this problem for many years.
fields.summary: While rendering web-panel JIRA always assumes default platform encoding for velocity templates

fields.description:
The attach Screenshot functionality not working with Java 7u51. This is a known issue with Java 7u51. Per the last message Atlassian is missing some attributes in their manifest file.

We had the same issue. To get out stuff to work after this change, and as an FYI potentially to Atlassian, our manifest (META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) changed from this:

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Trusted-Library: true
Created-By: 1.6.0-internal (Sun Microsystems Inc.)

To this:

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Trusted-Library: true
Created-By: 1.6.0-internal (Sun Microsystems Inc.)
Permissions: all-permissions
Codebase: *
Application-Library-Allowable-Codebase: *
Caller-Allowable-Codebase: *
Application-Name: iGrafx Applet

Obviously, they would need to change the application-name.  We probably need a couple of permissions they don’t – but it was a pain to figure this out.
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot functionality not working with Java 7u51

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37125].
  {panel}

When you triage or otherwise edit an issue, you can't then read the details in the issue.  Nor can you select to copy/paste form them.

This is a pretty significant usability issue.  Surprised that is not obvious to  your UX folks.

Use case:
I read a review a new bug.  Click triage and then assign and type a comment. But I need to re-read a bit of the details to write the correct comment / suggestion on a fix.  But alas, I need to open a new browser window, open the ticket and read it.  Uggh!

2nd use case:
Same triage scenario but I need to decide who to assign to.  I need to see the person who submitted.  Today I can widen the browser window to see on the right but I should not need to.

I'd suggest make the modal dialogs resizable and movable.
fields.summary: Need easy way to see issue details while performing edit actions in modal dialg

fields.description:
My JIRA dashboard contains an activity stream.
If this action happens:
  User James Admin creates an issue on behalf of another user (Joe X. Bar), immediately setting the reporter field to "Joe X. Bar".

Then the Activity Stream contains the sentence:
   Joe X. Bar created MOD-159 - Subject

This is misleading, as Joe was not actually logged in.
Could this be replaced by a more exact version?

For example:
"James Admin created MOD-159 - Subject (on behalf of Joe X. Bar)"
fields.summary: Misleading sentence in Activity stream

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Download and install from scratch JIRA 6.2, 6.2.1 or 6.2.2 (release candidate or final)
# Click the "Agile" top level menu item
## This will prompt the user to "Try JIRA Agile"
## Follow the prompts to download and install the plugin
## Do *not* enter my.atlassian.com credentials and close the dialog or refresh the page

OR

# Download and install from scratch JIRA 6.2, 6.2.1 or 6.2.2 (release candidate or final)
# Install JIRA Agile plugin manually (either via UPM or installed-plugins directory)
# Do *not* license JIRA Agile in any way

h3. Symptoms

* Agile button appears when JIRA Agile is not installed

* For JIRA Administrators, two "Agile" top level menu items appear in the navigation bar.
** One will direct the user to UPM to enter a license for JIRA Agile
** The other will open the dialog which prompts the admin to "Try JIRA Agile"

h3. Work-around

Any of these options should work:
* Disable the *JIRA Agile Marketing Plugin* via UPM
* Disable the {{gha-od-menu-item}} web-item plugin module inside the JIRA Agile Marketing Plugin via UPM
* License JIRA Agile (an evaluation license will suffice)
* Each administrator can "dismiss" the "Try JIRA Agile" dialog and it will not show again.
fields.summary: Two Agile menus visible in JIRA 6.2 BTF

h3. +Workaround:+
# Download [^workflow-designer-plugin-6.2.0-m5-379.jar] (this is the version bundled in JIRA 6.2 rc1).
# Navigate to *Administration » Add-ons » Manage Add-ons*,

fields.description:
For some reason, we keep getting this message when browsing to our Jira instance:
-----
We've detected a potential problem with JIRA's Dashboard configuration that your administrator can correct.
Dashboard Diagnostics: Mismatched URL Port
JIRA is reporting that it is running on the port '8080', which does not match the hostname used to run these diagnostics, '80'. This is known to cause JIRA to construct URLs using the incorrect port, which will result in errors in the dashboard, among other issues.
The most common cause of this is the use of a reverse-proxy HTTP server (often Apache or IIS) in front of the application server running JIRA. While this configuration is supported, some additional setup might be necessary in order to ensure that JIRA detects the correct port.
------
The server.xml file appears to be correct (only the relevant section included):
----
<Connector port="8080"

                   maxThreads="150"
                   minSpareThreads="25"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"

                   enableLookups="false"
                   maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                   useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
                   redirectPort="8443"
                   acceptCount="100"
                   disableUploadTimeout="true"/>
                   proxyName="issues.practichem.com"
                   proxyPort="80"
        <!--
-----
I'm not at all certain why this is popping up.  What can I do to fix this?

I would like to add a new value to a custom field Select List.  There is no ADD operation for this custom field, only GET.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37088].
  {panel}

When we raise a defect we have an option 'Attachments' , wherein we attach the screenshots of the issue so that the developer gets a better understanding about the issue.

Am attaching a screenshot while creating a defect it has a name say for example 'abc'. 
When I attach another screenshot with same name 'abc'. 
It allows me to attach the screenshot. This causes a lot of issues.

When a tester attaches a screenshot with the name 'abc' and a developer after fixing defect if he/she attaches a screenshot with the same name 'abc',confusion arises.


Suggested solution : 
JIRA shouldn't allow attachment of screenshots with the same name to avoid confusions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37084].
  {panel}

 When we raise a defect we have an option 'Attachments' , wherein we attach the screenshots of the issue so that the developer gets a better understanding about the issue.

Once the developer fixes the defect , he/she attaches the screenshot of the issue being fixed and updates it in the defect through 'Attachments' option

Then the tester retests the defect and if the defect still exists he/she attaches the screenshot of the issue that stills exists and updates the same in the defect through 'Attachments' option

The issue comes here. 
1. The tester attaches the screenshot with a name say 'xyz'. 
2. The developer fixes the issue and attaches the screenshot with a name 'abc'. 
3. The tester retests the issue and attaches the screenshot (with a name 'mns') to prove that the issue still exists 
4. The tester retests the issue and attaches the screenshot (with a name 'opq') to prove that the issue doesn't exist anymore and its working fine  

Now when someone (apart from that tester/developer) sees this defect its very difficult to understand the screenshots attached.

 He/she will not know the below :
1. which screenshot is attached by the tester that depicts the issue ?
2. which screenshot is attached by the developer to show that he has fixed the issue ?
3. which screenshot is attached by the tester after retesting to prove that the issue still exists  ?
4. which screenshot is attached by the tester after retesting to prove that the issue doesnt exists anymore and its working fine  ?


Few new options can be introduced while we attach the screenshot , like
1.  Screenshot attached by tester while raising the defect
2.  Screenshot attached by developer after fixing the defect
3.  Screenshot attached by tester after retesting the defect

These options can be given at the time we raise a defect or edit the defect. We can attach the screenshots to the respective options, which will be displayed on the defect page as separate entities.

This improves the clarity on the screenshots attached and dispels ambiguity
fields.summary: Improvements related to 'Attachments' in defect

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

If the Confluence which JIRA is linked to is migrated, then under certain circumstances, issue links from JIRA to Confluence would still be pointing to the old server instead of the new one

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an applink between my JIRA and Confluence
# Export a Confluence backup, and restore it in a different PC
# Change the URL of the applink to the IP of that new PC
# Try accessing the link from a JIRA issue to a Confluence page

It should be showing this link :

!proper URl.png|thumbnail!

But, if the user is not logged into JIRA, it is showing the old link :

!wrong URL.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

There is a case where the link does not work if the user is not a member of the 'confluence-users' group. Although I was unable to reproduce that behavior, the similarities in the behaviors makes me think that they are affected by the same bug, as the old link should not be shown under any circumstances
fields.summary: Link to Confluence in JIRA does not show the correct URL

fields.description:
Hi,

Our client, who uses JIRA with us, frequently complains about the useless state of this feature, so I checked it out myself.

This particular test system is running OS X Mavericks, Java Version 7 Update 51, Google Chrome 32.0.1700.107 and Mozilla Firefox 27.0.1.

These are my findings:

* Google Chrome has abysmal support for Java, so you pretty much can't use Chrome to use this feature.

* When using Firefox, if the popup window seems stuck on the Java logo, click on the logo and the correct form appears.

* If this works, it requires you to have stored the screenshot in your clipboard. On Mac OS X, this can be done like so:
** Command+Control+Shift+3: takes a screenshot of the entire screen and saves it to the Clipboard
** Command+Control+Shift+4: enables you to select an area, which it takes a screenshot of and saves it to the Clipboard

* HOWEVER, in my tests in Firefox, after hitting the paste button, the form becomes completely unresponsive.
fields.summary: Attach a Screenshot feature completely broken

  {panel}

Monospaced formatting adds a border intended for *\{noformat\}* and *\{code\}*

The _Text Formatting Notation Help_ page shows monospaced should look like this:
!http://i.imgur.com/AS3RAP2.png!

However when {color:black}\{\{{color}monospaced{color:black}\}\}{color} is rendered, it looks like this:
!http://i.imgur.com/1rKX9z8.png!

The border seems to be more appropriate for the \{noformat\} and \{code\} tag, but not inline monospaced text.
